Our Clinics

WellMed Bangkok Clinics are renowned for its exceptional standards of care, cleanliness, and professionalism. Our modern, fully equipped clinics provide a safe, comfortable environment where every patient is treated with respect and attention. With a team of English-speaking doctors and nurses, we make healthcare simple, clear, and accessible for both locals and expats. 

Silom

64 building (Floor 3, Si Lom Rd, Suriya Wong, Bang Rak, Bangkok 10500

Directions

Sukhumvit Clinic

อาคาร วสุ 1 เลขที่ 1 Soi Sukhumvit 25, Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Bangkok 10110

Directions

We provide medical services for everyone with safety, care and high quality

With a commitment to safety, care, and high-quality medical services, we cater to patients from around the world. Our experienced team is fluent in English, Spanish, and Thai, ensuring clear communication and personalized care for all.

We strive to create an eco-friendly environment that provides comfort and relaxation during your visit. Whether you seek routine care or specific medical attention, our team is dedicated to empowering you with lasting health and well-being. Choose WellMed Bangkok Clinic for excellence in medical care and experience wellness like never before.

19 days ago
Highly recommended for foreigners in Bangkok! I contacted them via WhatsApp and got a very quick response and a same-day appointment. The staff is welcoming and speaks perfect English. Aicha
19 days ago
If I could give this place a 0/10, I would. I came here for basic blood tests and the experience was a nightmare from start to finish.
​Despite making an appointment in advance, I was made to wait a full hour. When I politely asked about the delay after 30 minutes, I was met with attitude and told I was "asking for too much" regarding prep time. The staff actually tried to guilt-trip me for asking. I might expect this kind of poor service in the US, but it is shocking to receive this treatment in Thailand, the Land of Smiles.
​The actual blood draw was even worse. The first nurse completely ignored my advice. I warned her I have small veins and asked her to check my hand (where I usually get successful draws). She refused, insisted on a vein in my arm that I knew was too small, and missed. She spent a solid 5-10 seconds digging the needle around inside my arm causing significant pain before I asked her to stop. She then switched with another nurse without saying a word.
​The second nurse walked in with zero knowledge of the situation. She tried right below where the first nurse failed and immediately started pulling way too hard on the syringe. This obviously collapsed the small vein, and the blood flow stopped almost instantly. When she tried to fish around with the needle again, I had to demand she stop.
​The result was a really bad bruise that left me in pain for the next two days, and I only walked away with enough blood for two tests.
​For comparison, I went to MedPro afterwards and received EXCELLENT service from beginning to end. They were on time, had zero attitude, and actually went out of their way to make me feel heard and welcome. To top it off, they were cheaper, and I was in and out within 15 minutes.
​Bottom line: If you are a laboratory that specializes in this service, the people who work here should know how to draw blood. That is literally your only job. Do not go here; go to MedPro instead.

M. A.
9 months ago
For a clinic where many people get tested for sensitive topics and are visible nervous/ insecure (holding others peoples Hands) they loudly call out patients full names (including family names) and discuss which medicines to take and for how long so everyone in the waiting room can hear it. This is not the professional behavior you would expect and some may wish for.

Secondly, they added charges at checkout that were not communicated in any shape of form beforehand (I.e. Nurse charge)!

Lastly, it’s all about money and upselling. If you get any kind of result, no matter how simple/ basic and the question requires a yes/ no or option A/ option B answer from the doctor. You will have to pay a full consultation session on top of the test to get an answer and not be ignored. Of course medicine prices are also way higher than pharmacies around the corner.

So I would recommend only if you are in a rush because they are fairly fast!

11 months ago
The clinic is slightly pricier compared to other local clinics, but I believe it's worth it. My husband had a severe fever and sinus issues, and after taking the prescribed medication just once, he felt significantly better.

I’m giving four stars mainly because of the front desk receptionist. We arrived at the clinic around 5:10 PM, and based on Google reviews, I knew walk-ins were accepted. However, the receptionist told us that there were too many bookings and asked us to return the next day. I explained that my husband had a very high fever and that we had traveled nearly an hour to get there. Instead of showing any empathy, she looked at me as if I couldn’t afford the bill—her demeanor was cold and unwelcoming, making me feel like I was beneath her.

Normally, I would have addressed such treatment immediately, but at that moment, my priority was my husband’s health. The rest of the staff, including the nurses and doctor, were friendly and highly professional. It’s unfortunate that the first point of contact at the clinic left such a negative impression. A receptionist should be warm, approachable, and understanding—something she clearly was not.

a year ago
I went here to get checked out for a sore throat and the staff were very friendly, fast, and efficient. The price of the visit was very affordable to me compared to what you'd pay in the U.S. without health insurance. I received a consultation, throat swab, some throat spray and just waiting to get my test results and medication if needed. All was included in the price which you pay the day you visit. You can also get a medical certificate if you want to use your insurance but not sure how American insurance works in Thailand if at all. Either way the price is still affordable without.

The online booking process was very easy and efficient. They are located in the lower floor of the building past the Radisson Blu hotel if coming from Phrom Phong. The friendly building security guards will point you in the right direction if you have trouble finding the clinic.

Not sure if it was luck or what but having the option to have a same day doctor visit without waiting several hours like at a walk-in clinic at home felt great and I would definitely use their services again if needed.

a year ago
After an unfortunate food poisoning incident I searched up many clinics and decided to go here because of the stellar reviews. I booked an appointment on their website which was very easy and upon entering the clinic. I was warmly greeted by the desk staff, filled out the necessary form, quick blood pressure taken by a nurse and was seen by the doctor fairly quickly.

The doctor was very friendly, thorough, asked questions to help determine what was wrong and spoke wonderful English. Afterwards the nurse gave me the medications which had clear instructions labelled but she also advised on how to take them as well.

The total bill for the consult and about a weeks worth of medication was 1200 Baht which I feel is very reasonable especially when you consider the location of the clinic and the professionalism of all the staff.

I left very satisfied with the entire experience and should I need any medical attention on future visits to Bangkok. I'll only go here as it was that good in my eyes. I can only highly recommend this clinic!

Staff are very friendly and super helpful. I would recommend this clinic definitely if you are a tourist in the Asok district.

My son who was 4 years old was sick while we were on a family trip to Bangkok. We didn’t make an appointment and went there as walk-in customer on a Saturday morning. All the staff there can speak English very well and greeted us. We only waited for 10 mins before seeing the doctor. The doctor was very patient and did all the necessary examinations. a year ago
I took tests at this clinic.
1. At the reception desk everything was explained in normal, understandable English. No additional services were imposed (+1)
2. Staff uses removable shoes (+1)
3. The nurse who took the blood put on new gloves in front of me (+1)
4. During the blood draw, the nurse distracted me with extraneous conversations, I did not notice how everything went. By the way, everything was quite painless and the scar went away in two days (+1)
5. After taking the tests, I was told that the result would be in 1-2 days. I received the results neither in three days, nor in a week, but within the specified period and without any additional reminders (+1)
6. The results were emailed with the doctor’s comments (+1)
It may seem that everything described above is elementary things, but experience has shown that in some other clinics they do not even comply with this

My only wish to the clinic management: please consider using shoe covers for clients, or ask them to put on replacement slippers or take off street shoes before entering the laboratory
I have got the only suggestion to the management of the clinic. Please, consider using special plastic shoe covers or your slippers for the clients of your clinic, or ask them to take off shoes when entering the lab

Dorji -
2 years ago
Had a painful sorethroat and I tried this clinic after reading the review. I just wanted to try out.

Overall, it was a brief and nice experience.

The front desk spoke perfect English, which is good. They were courteous and professional. And told me the consultation fee would be 700-1,000B

The doctor did a quick examination and concluded that it was a viral infection and not bacterial. So, just to manage it with an organic spray, which he prescribed.

Unlike the international hospitals there were no charges for taking your temperature and pressure (approx 500B). Just the doctor fee of 700B and not upwards of 1,500B as in the international hospitals.

Highly recommended if some seasonal ailments or travel bugs are bothering you. Or as a first stop before you go the super-luxurious hospitals.

Welcome to WellMed Clinic Bangkok: Your Gateway to Comprehensive Healthcare

WellMed Bangkok Clinic caters to both local and international patients with unparalleled medical care. Our clinic is a harmonious blend of modern medical expertise and the warmth of Thai hospitality, making healthcare accessible and comfortable for everyone. With a team of professionals fluent in English, Spanish, and Thai, we ensure that communication is seamless, allowing us to focus on what matters most: your health and well-being.

Your Visit to WellMed Clinic: A Seamless Experience

Located just a 3-minute walk from BTS Asok and MRT Sukhumvit, WellMed Clinic is easily accessible, making your journey to us as smooth as possible. Our convenient location in the Vasu 1 building, at the Sukhumvit main road, (Check-out our location Here) ensures that you can reach us without hassle, with free parking available for all our visitors. Our flexible appointment scheduling, from 9am to 6pm daily, including public holidays, allows you to find a time that best suits your busy lifestyle. With our clear communication, transparent pricing, and a wide range of insurance acceptances, your healthcare experience with us is guaranteed to be stress-free and positive.

Comprehensive Services Tailored to Meet Your Needs

WellMed Clinic offers a wide array of medical services, ensuring that your health concerns are addressed promptly and effectively. Our clinic also provides STD/STI testing, COVID-19 testing, vaccinations, and much more, ensuring comprehensive care under one roof. For those who prefer the comfort of their own space, our teleconsultation services offer medical advice and guidance remotely, making quality healthcare more accessible than ever.
